description: From Middle English scribblen, scriblen, scryblen, scribelen, equivalent to scribe +â€Ž -le (frequentative suffix).

entries.meaning: Careless, hasty writing, doodle or drawing

verbs.description: scribble (third-person singular simple present scribbles, present participle scribbling, simple past and past participle scribbled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To write or draw carelessly and in a hurry.
examples: I suddenly remembered I needed to buy bleach, so scribbled it down on my shopping list.

entries.meaning: To write badly; to work as an inferior author or journalist.

verbs.description: scribble (third-person singular simple present scribbles, present participle scribbling, simple past and past participle scribbled)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To card or tease (wool) coarsely; to run through a scribbler.
